algorithm_technique: Simulation with careful calculation of possible minute/second combinations.
problem_summary_simple: Find the cheapest way to input a cooking time into a microwave, considering finger movement and push costs.
problem_summary_technical: Simulate inputting target seconds by considering two primary minute/second splits, calculating cost based on startAt, moveCost, and pushCost.
key_insights: The problem can be reduced to checking only two main ways to represent the target seconds: (m, s) and (m-1, s+60).
The cost calculation involves iterating through the digits of the time, accounting for moves and pushes.
Edge cases like single-digit inputs are handled by the microwave's normalization.
